original_solution_mapping.L1: The truck tank has 10 gallons in it because 20 x .5 = <<20*.5=10>>10
original_solution_mapping.L2: The car tank has 4 gallons in it because 12 x (1/3) = <<12*(1/3)=4>>4
original_solution_mapping.L3: She needs to add 10 gallons to the truck because 20 - 10 = <<20-10=10>>10
original_solution_mapping.L4: She needs to add 8 gallons to the car because 12 - 4 = <<12-4=8>>8
original_solution_mapping.L5: She needs to add 18 gallons in total because 10 + 8 = <<10+8=18>>18

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4156.
    Returns: the total number of gallons Wendy adds to her tanks.
    """
    # L1
    truck_tank_capacity = 20 # 20 gallons
    truck_fill_fraction = 0.5 # half full
    truck_current_gallons = truck_tank_capacity * truck_fill_fraction

    # L2
    car_tank_capacity = 12 # 12 gallons
    car_fill_fraction = Fraction(1, 3) # 1/3 full
    car_current_gallons = car_tank_capacity * car_fill_fraction

    # L3
    gallons_to_add_truck = truck_tank_capacity - truck_current_gallons

    # L4
    gallons_to_add_car = car_tank_capacity - car_current_gallons

    # L5
    total_gallons_to_add = gallons_to_add_truck + gallons_to_add_car

    # FA
    answer = total_gallons_to_add
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The truck tank has {truck_current_gallons} gallons in it because {truck_tank_capacity} x {truck_fill_fraction} = <<{truck_tank_capacity}*{truck_fill_fraction}={truck_current_gallons}>>{truck_current_gallons}
The car tank has {car_current_gallons} gallons in it because {car_tank_capacity} x ({car_fill_fraction}) = <<{car_tank_capacity}*({car_fill_fraction})={car_current_gallons}>>{car_current_gallons}

She needs to add {gallons_to_add_truck} gallons to the truck because {truck_tank_capacity} - {truck_current_gallons} = <<{truck_tank_capacity}-{truck_current_gallons}={gallons_to_add_truck}>>{gallons_to_add_truck}
She needs to add {gallons_to_add_car} gallons to the car because {car_tank_capacity} - {car_current_gallons} = <<{car_tank_capacity}-{car_current_gallons}={gallons_to_add_car}>>{gallons_to_add_car}

She needs to add {total_gallons_to_add} gallons in total because {gallons_to_add_truck} + {gallons_to_add_car} = <<{gallons_to_add_truck}+{gallons_to_add_car}={total_gallons_to_add}>>{total_gallons_to_add}
